intro: Eriocoma parishii subsp. parishii, commonly known as the Parry's eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and cliffs. Its botanical features make it an important component of arid ecosystems.
